structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.catch_line: Hearing to revoke, suspend, probate, or refuse to renew license -- Violation may be enjoined -- Enforcement -- Appeal.

text.section: A suspension, probation, or revocation of a license, or a refusal to renew a license, may be made or a fine imposed by the board only after a hearing which shall be conducted in accordance with KRS Chapter 13B.

The board may institute, in its own name, proceedings to temporarily or permanently restrain and enjoin violations of KRS 311.380 to 311.510, regardless of whether the defendant has been convicted for violations of the penal provisions thereof, and shall not be required to pay any cost or filing fees or furnish any bond in connection therewith. Violations of injunctions and restraining orders shall be punished as a contempt without the intervention of a jury.

A licensee whose license has been revoked, probated, or suspended, or against whom a fine has been imposed by the board, or who has been refused a renewal license, may appeal a final order of the board to the Circuit Court of the county in which the hearing was held.

law.history: Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 318, sec. 253, effective July 15, 1996. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 166, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1986. -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 197, sec. 6. -- Created 1948 Ky. Acts ch. 176, sec. 12.
